comment.realname: lifeasdaddy ...a guy, his wife, and their son...
comment.author: 13267298@N00
comment._content: I wonder who took this photograph.  It is a bitmore artistically composed than most of the pics associated with the Harbour Bridge and railway constructions.

comment.author: 29029178@N03
comment._content: It looks as though it was taken just prior to opening. There are still construction material on the platform being no 1 & 2. Note the bubbler on platform 3, and also the destination board. It shows the limit of suburban train operation at that time, being Parramatta and Liverpool. The electrification of the line beyond Parramatta was not done till the mid 1950's and beyond Liverpool in 1968. The north section should show Hornsby, but its a little hard to read. There is still space for more lines

comment.author: 57994656@N05
comment._content: My guess is that the picture was a government funded advertisement about the opening of the station. I'm astonished at how modern Town Hall looked when it was built about 80 years ago similar design and concepts would still be used today today.

comment.author: 27331537@N06
comment._content:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/yumanuma] I agree, the station looks very modern. The photo is part of a series called "State Rail Authority Archives Photographic Reference Print Collection" [NRS 17420] which consists of reference prints and negatives drawn from a variety of sources, primarily sources within State Rail and its predecessor organisations.

AB
